required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PTCy and Ruxolitinib vs PTCy, Tacrolimus and MMF in MUD and Haploidentical HSCT
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Multicenter, Open-label Phase II Trial to Compare Prophylaxis of Graft Versus Host Disease With Tacrolimus and Mycophenolate Mofetil Versus Ruxolitinib After Post-transplant Cyclophosphamide

lead_sponsor.agency: St. Petersburg State Pavlov Medical University

clinical_study.source: St. Petersburg State Pavlov Medical University

brief_summary.textblock:
This is multicenter investigator-initiated randomized open-label phase II clinical trial to compare prophylaxis of graft versus host disease treated with tacrolimus and mycophenolate mofetil versus ruxolitinib after post-transplant cyclophosphamide.
In total 128 patients will be included in the study. After inclusion into the study and performing of transplantation patients will be randomized in 1:1 proportion in two arms (64 patients per arm): arm A will include patients who will be treated with cyclophosphamide and ruxolitinib for GVHD prophylaxis; arm B will include patients who will be treated with cyclophosphamide, tacrolimus and MMF for GVHD prophylaxis. After the end of the treatment patients will be followed-up during two years.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of acute GVHD grade II-IV
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with acute GVHD II-IV grade

secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative incidence of patients with mortality without hematological relapse of malignancy
Cumulative incidence of patients with relapse

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of moderate and severe chronic GVHD
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative incidence of patients with moderate and severe chronic GVHD according to NIH 2015 criteria
Kaplan-Meier estimate of death from all causes
Kaplan-Meier estimate of death or relapse

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of HSCT-associated adverse events (safety and toxicity)
secondary_outcome.description: Toxicity assessment is based on NCI CTC AE 5.0 grades. Veno-occlusive disease incidence and severity assessment is based on EBMT criteria 2016. Transplant-associated microangiopathy incidence assessment is based on Cho et al. criteria. All toxicity measurements will be aggregated as severity scores.
Cumulative incidence of patients with primary or secondary graft failure defined by the absence of donor chimerism.

Number of patients with bacteremia before engraftment, bacteremia after engraftment, severe sepsis (presence of multiple organ failure), pneumonia, soft tissue infection, invasive mycosis (probable or proven invasive aspergillosis, candidaemia, zygomycosis), reactivation of cytomegalovirus, other opportunistic viral infections

arm_group.description: Conditioning: fludarabine 180 mg/m2 busulfan 8-14 mg/kg per os GVHD prophylaxis: cyclophosphamide 50 mg/kg day+3, +4 tacrolimus 0.03 mg/kg from day+5 to 100 mycophenolate mofetil 30 mg/kg from day+5 to 35

Conditioning: fludarabine 180 mg/m2 busulfan 8-14 mg/kg per os ruxolitinib 5 mg tid days -7 to -2 GVHD prophylaxis: cyclophosphamide 50 mg/kg day+3, +4 ruxolitinib 5 mg tid days +5 to +21 ruxolitinib 5 mg bid days +22 to +150

intervention.description: Ruxolitinib administered during conditioning 5 mg tid before allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation, 5 mg tid days 5-21 and 5 mg bid days 22-150 after transplantation instead of tacrolimus and MMF.
Tacrolimus 0.03 mg/kg adjusted to concentrations 5-15 ng/ml from day+5 to +100
Mycophenolate mofetil 30 mg/kg from day +5 to +35

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: St. Petersburg State Pavlov Medical University
responsible_party.investigator_title: RM Gorbacheva Research institute scientific director

patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Per request to the Ethical Committee of Pavlov University with the study plan and rationale for the use of the data.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
